reviewText: WOW!!..she's on the beach for her 53rd birthday and with a younger man!(8/2011)...she can do whatever she wants(almost) and get away with it...I would NEVER buy this DVD cause I think she overcharges for her concerts...but this one I saw on Ovation TV channel and it was exceptional.I say that because every song was like a "vignette" and she had licensed out the images of Keith Haring for one song etc..it was over the top and done so well..the production is always great in her concerts but in NYC, who the heck can afford over 200 bucks for one seat..I hate sitting in the SKY for any concert..but her concert, you need a decent seat..and Madison Square Garden, is so BIG and also the way they setup that stage, cause there are different configurations of a stage for any performer.The last time I spent BIG BUCKS and so worth it, was for George Michael...his voice is so amazing and the music he writes is amazing..so about 500 /seat but the stage was setup like a runway and at the end was a piano and we were right there...great pictures we got and also sat with some HUGE fans!!..this woman & husband in front of us, began talking  & she went to EVERY concert he gave around the friggin WORLD!..that's a FAN!...but with some other people I have seen at this venue, Bjork, you can sit on the side ..and the stage is BARE, I am thinking did they cancel the concert and I don't know it...well she's so HIGH TECH, everything, from lights to sets are literally in a box and all laser lights..that was a great show..she always gives great shows..saw her in Sydney in the 90s and that was also amazin.The Last time I saw Madonna was in the 80s & we had amazing seats...but this concert ,filmed outside in Buenos Aires...is so beautifully done..the people there are pretty poor and she thanked them for waiting DAYS AND DAYS for a ticket...sorry,I ain't 20 anymore, no one is THAT great but a HUGE friggin crowd and she was right on...and when I saw that they had it in bluray..I headed over to Overstock.com....less than 17 bucks and I have free shipping but I do want the music...she does NOT sing every note..THAT I WANT TO SAY..she's "filler" for the taped music....L.Gaga said that on HBO.."I SING ALL THE MUSIC"..well Lady, I love you but that concert at MSG on HBO ,part was TAPED and if you say that, mean it!..remember the times of Frank Sinatra...no friggin taping at ALL, well he wasn't dancing either...so IF you are not singing, don't say a line like Lady Gaga did..I still love her music but that was a huge mistake..there is NO WAY you can dance your behind off and have a NOTE come out of your mouth...so this concert with Madonna, allot is taped and I can tell when she actually sings cause she's also DANCING! but it's good enough for me to own..need the music nowCheers..Tony(nyc)

reviewText: Madonna has always been innovative in her live shows. That she has released several over the years is a testament to her changing style. Always well done, always slightly controversial always fun. The Sticky and Sweet Tour was no exception.Recorded in Argentina the video presents the complete concert with lots of cutaways to fan reactions. The song selection for this show relies a little more heavily than I'd have hoped on her newer material. The remixes of some of the older material provide unique interpretations of songs like Into the Groove and Borderline while the audience sing along on Like a Virgin was kind of unexpected.The BluRay release is a little short on extras providing only some backstage material. This is a fun package that is well worth owning for fans of the singer or her music.

Title: N/A

reviewText: I happened to see this show in LA after missing the NYC series.  Now why that show wasn't recorded for DVD/Blu-Ray is beyond me: it was a day or so after Obama won the Presidency and all the Prop 8 protests (which Madonna candidly spoke about), plus Britney came out for 'Human Nature' and Justin for '4 Minutes' (it didn't get better than that).  But watching it again since they showed it on EPIX back in October (it's still on my DVR and sadly I watch it at least twice a month LOL) made me really realize how good of a show this was.'Sticky & Sweet' wasn't a serious show--not a message show like 'Confessions' or 'Re-Invention' with dark undertones--it was just a fun show, a really good time.  Lots of color, lots of choreography, and lots of energy and interaction with Madonna and the audience unlike I've ever seen her do in the past.  When you see the expressions on the fans' faces and the performers you will ultimately get that.  I'm half this woman's age and she showed that she can keep up with the youngins in the game today like it's nothing--she did it so effortlessly and it didn't look like she had to try much.  I mean, I've seen her many times before and usually by the end it feels like a club atmosphere and people are in the aisles losing it and letting loose, but it felt like a club, house party, or block party the entire night.  It was very much in the vein of festival style.  I've never danced at a Madonna show really until this one and had such a genuinely good time.My favorite number hands down was 'Vogue 2008' where she incorporated the '4 Minutes' beat.  Sick.  The staging and costuming was remniscent of 'The Girlie Show' tour.  I loved the portion of the show where everyone was dressed in NYC B-boy style from the 80s, it was such a throwback and I gained even more respect for her showing respect to the Hip-Hop community that paved the way for dance and rap, and doing it well might I add with all the old-school samples that were mixed into her classic songs.  Since the cylinder screens above the second stage were damaged at the LA show (light bulb: could this be why LA wasn't filmed?), it was nice to see on this what songs like 'Rain' and 'Devil Wouldn't Recognize You' were supposed to look like visually.I have nothing bad to say about this, other than the fact that this Blu-Ray is listed as including the 13-track CD like the DVD, which it does not (I of course bought both since I'm a fan but others may want to take heed if you're not as loyal as I am, I think Amazon goofed on this).  I did get annoyed with some of the cut-aways and how they would slow down some of the sequences and jazz them up a bit but it wasn't anything major.  I think the behind-the-scenes featurette was probably the best I've ever seen from her, I don't think I've smiled so much.  We all know she's gotten alot of BS in the past in terms of her attitude or whatever, but these were some of the most genuine and candid moments I've seen that really show her human side: from her work ethic to her heart (the speech she gave to the crew in the prayer circle the night in San Diego when Obama won the election even got me a little misty).  It's a really good companion piece to the tour.This tour showed Madonna at her finest, vocally and aesthetically.Can't wait for the next tour!
summary: You Just HAD to Be There...But This Is Just As Fun!

reviewText: With the Sweet and Sticky Tour, Madonna proved to the world that at 50, the world's in her hands. While I thought that the Confessions Tour and Drowned World Tour were fantastic, Madonna upped the ante with this tour. The energy was just amazing and the re-arrangements for the few old songs really did the trick. And there was a beautiful rendition of You Must Love Me to boot, the crowd-acoustic Like A Virgin which would put any critics to shame about saying that Madonna can't sing. Her voice was anything but impeccable. And all those dancing and prancing really would make anyone half her age feel embarrassed. The guitar-drenched Hung Up and Ray of Light were refreshing and never failed to keep the atmosphere up. The closer, Give It 2 Me, was simply breathtaking.If anything but, the blu ray made me rediscover how great Madonna is and the Hard Candy album is really a versatile and fun album.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Madonna's "Reinvention" tour found her in a very political and introspective state of mind, following her folky "American Life" album. And her "Confessions" tour found her playing the role of elder disco diva.With "Sticky and Sweet" Madonna's focus seems to be on youth. Following her "Hard Candy" album, easily the most commercial record of her career, and produced by of-the-moment hitmakers like Timbaland, Pharrell, and Justin Timberlake, the tone of "Sticky and Sweet" is youthful, urban, athletic, and fun. For the most part, the politics and avante garde artiness that Madonna often infuses into her tours is kept to a minimum. This is Madonna at her most basic: an unstoppable force of energy, bravado, and sexuality.That being said, I personally don't think this is her best tour. Maybe I miss the more provocative, rebellious, and experimental persona of the past. I like when Madonna pushes the boundaries of pop music and performance, challenging a mainstream audience into territory usually only reserved for the underground. That Madonna is mostly absent on "Sticky and Sweet," and instead we have a middle-aged icon in incredible physical shape singing high-energy pop songs, dancing up a storm, appearing youthful, hyper-energized, and ready to have a good time. And it's all well and good.But any Madonna fan knows that this persona won't last. We'll just have to wait and see what the lady comes up with next.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Let me start by saying that I know this review is going to be very unpopular, especially with Madonna fans - which I have always been. The potential for this CD/DVD package was enormous. Madonna live, audio, video, extras - what more could you ask for, right? Well, aside from the attractive packaging, I felt "blah" about this release. The "Sticky & Sweet Tour" just didn't quite grab me like the "Confessions" tour did a few years ago. Confessions was the album and tour that Madonna always wanted to do. It was the perfect marriage of music and visuals brought to the stage, at a time in M's career when critics were starting to doubt her relevance in the music industry. About to turn 50, Maddie proudly and firmly gave the "bird" to all the naysayers, showing everyone why she is the Queen. It was an affirmation of her dedication and longevity in a brutal age-biased industry. The Hard Candy CD and the Sticky & Sweet Tour seemed to be a step backward in my opinion. The songs just didn't have the flair, and the tour seemed littered with unnecessary longings for a youth that she had - I thought - long since outgrown. Short-shorts, graffitied subway graphics and her gutter language seemed so out of place and superfluous. The arrangements for the songs seemed odd as well. I normally love mash-ups, but the choices she made on this tour left me wanting more. I did like the rock version of Borderline and the defiance of Human Nature. Spanish Lesson, Miles Away and She's Not Me are just plain weak songs. Those weaknesses are tragically exposed in a setlist of M classics like Vogue, Music and even recent, much better songs, like Hung Up. Perhaps stage producer Jamie King has simply run out of ideas. This saddens me, because he did such a phenomenal job on the Confessions Tour. Directors Nathan Rissman and Nick Wickham had a difficult job: create an engaging DVD production of this show with an enthusiastic audience, but a somewhat lackluster performance. The "trick" that was used on the Confessions DVD to stunning effect, which is to incorporate the stage back-drop images into the actual visuals of the DVD, just didn't work for this particular show. This technique was astounding on the Confessions DVD. The images popped out, wrapped themselves around you, and washed you away to another place. On this DVD that same technique seems forced. You got the immediate sense that it's been done, we've seen it. And these visuals are not worthy of that treatment. I know this review appears harsh. I don't doubt Madonna's strength as a legendary artist and performer. The "Hard Candy" CD and tour earned M a brand new legion of enthusiastic young fans. Not many artists can make such a claim. The Aerosmiths' and Rolling Stones' of the world have their base of loyal fans and those bands are content with that. They generally don't gear their newer CD's or tours as campaigns for new fans. Madonna has consistently broken these types of rules throughout her career. It's been her blessing and her curse. She's worked hard, never settled for anything but the best, and never placed limits on herself. It's these character traits that set her apart from other artists. However, it's these same traits that only reveal the moments when she can do better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Note to Madonna: Please fire the producer of your concert DVDs or send them a memo that simply states "Less is More".While I am not a Madonna-basher and own every album and video she's put out in the last 25 years, I cannot say I truly enjoyed the Sticky and Sweet Tour on DVD. The main reason is the hyperactive editing that runs rampant throughout the 2-hour show. The camera does not stay focused on anything for more than two seconds. Instead, we have unnecessary jumps and cuts all over the place that just about give one a massive headache. I made it through to the end but I doubt I will be watching this atrocity again anytime soon.Earlier concert DVDs such as The Girlie Show or Drowned World did not suffer from this problem. Editors need to know that this type of thing may have been cutting edge back in 2000 but this was beyond overkill.Madonna should scale things back for her next tour and get back to basics: Good music, good dancing, eye-catching sets are all she needs to put on a decent show. She certainly doesn't need images of Britney Spears on the 12-foot screens behind her!All griping aside, I thought the best parts were Madonna taking on her "impersonators" in "She's Not Me", and dancing among the monks in "Spanish Lesson". "Candy Shop" was a dull opener the way "Erotica" was back during the Girlie Show and this tour lacked the spark of Confessions and earlier ones. I did notice she seemed to enjoy herself more here though and was more interactive with the audience.Rent or borrow a friend's copy before you buy this.

reviewText: I really enjoyed this dvd, it's energizing to see Madonna deliver yet another stunning live performance, she delivers a truly creative performance with her entire show.  The crowd is spectacular and responsive, the camera work is excellent, and the entire concert is one of my favorites yet.Madonna's a top-performing star of our generation, and she's motivational to watch, and here she gives one of her best performances ever - stunning showmanship, musical excellence and tight dance moves from her and her dancers.  Favorite tracks are Vogue 2008, Music 2008, Ray of Light and Give it 2 Me.  Great concert dvd, highly recommended.Madonna, thanks for being the best.  You define 'reinvention', overdelivering time and time again. I've been a fan since the mtv 80s and still continue to be, even more so today.-ken
summary: Madonna's done it again - super concert DVD, lots of energy

Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of those concert performances (emphasis on performance) that is visually bombastic, aurally perfect and yet, seems lacking.  Filmed in Buenos Aires, Argentina in a huge open air stadium, Madonna's local fan base is quickly whipped into a frenzy that never lets up.  Clearly Madonna and her large troupe of singers, musicians and dancers are invigorated by the audience.The scope of the concert is as large as I've ever seen.  Videos, cameos, local talent, lights, sound effects are all there in vibrant living color.  Yet much of what we see feels the same as we've seen over the years in numerous concert videos.  Here, Madonna covers plenty of older material as well as some new stuff and does it well, just like in the music videos she helped popularize more than 30 years ago.  Madonna is in good voice, a bit deeper than what I remember.  A result of aging I guess which by the way, she shows little of.  Her 50 something body is amazingly fit and she rarely takes a deep breath even when engaging in what must be described as a high pitched cardio workout.I was actually most taken when she slows down a bit, which unfortunately isn't often.  My biggest complaint is the direction and editing.  Maybe it's just me aging as well, but this concert is 2 hours of quick cuts including some that are out of synch.  It all just made me dizzy, especially with all the color.  Too much going on with the production numbers but no time to really focus on what they are doing...or even how well.The music?  Well, all over the place.  Some great ("Here Comes the Rain Again"), some not.  What is great is the audio coming from the DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 track.  This one is demo grade from beginning to end, with all the speakers getting in on the action, including subs.  The video is only 1080i but I could see no issues with any of the shots.  Everybody looked good, sweat droplets and all.
summary: 3 1/2 stars for a great sounding and vibrant concert film

reviewText: I personally attended this concert in Paris in 2008. The sound was out of control, featuring a very heavy annoying bassline. I was sure they WB would heavily edit the sound for the Blue-Ray release so they did. The sound quality on the Blue-Ray is simply amazing, crystal clear.Now to the setlist - I am not a big fan of her Hard Candy at all, in fact, I do believe it's the laziest Madonna production since 1989. So keeping that in mind and having Hard Candy songs heavily included into the setlist, I knew I would be skipping a lit of songs on this Blue-Ray. Although, I did enjoy the raunchy opening act Candy Shop, having Madonna repeatedly say "my sugar is sweet"...any idea what she is referring to??:-) The whole concept of the S&S; Tour was a departure from the hi-end Madonna shows, featuring amazing screen videos and remixes, including choreography and outfits as well. Madonna's musical producer did a very poor job remaking the songs, without any creativity and real work involved. As a result, we get bizarre sounding old songs, pretending to sound upbeat and clubby. So, I have been skipping most of the songs even the first time I got the blue-ray, including:Human NatureVogue 2008 (can't stand the 4 minutes beat used)Die Another Day 2008 (speeded up poor remix)Into The Groove 2008HeartbeatBorderlineShe's Not MeMusic 2008Rain/Here Comes The Rain AgainDevil Wouldn't Recognize YouLa Isla Bonita MedleyMe Darava/Doli DoliGet Stupid Medley4 Minutes feat. Justin Timberlake and TimbalandLike A Prayer 2008Ray Of LightLike A VirginHung Up MedleyGive It 2 MeMy personal highlights of the show include:Candy Shop MedleyBeat Goes On MedleySpanish LessonMiles AwayYou Must Love MeDon't Cry For Me ArgentinaBut are these six favorites really enough for me and the whole concert?? Not really! Another disappointment during the show was Madonna's attempt to have the audience sing along with her, so she ended up ruining many songs, especially amazing Miles Away, desperately shouting several times. In fact, the audience really did an amazing job towards the end of Miles Away, making it so special for all of us. That's the way to go for it, instead of having the crowed sing along to every damn song...that's how you have a highlight of the show, when everybody in the audience does it deep from the heart. My very special compliments go to the audience of Buenos Aires - what an amazing and great looking bunch of people. Now I really understand why Madonna is not going back to Australia - seeing the dead and bored audience in the Girlie Show makes my heart bleed!Now Madonna's outfits - Candy Shop outfit did rock...she looked amazing but towards the end of Beat Goes on she takes most of the stuff off and looks embarrassing...Yes, she is in a great shape but still looks awful with no dress on...Old school outfits were horrifying, especially those ugly shorts and tops! Her outfit during Spanish Lessons was really sexy and made her look sizzling hot and youthful. Do not expect any close-up shots on this DVD...nothing like several beautiful closeups on Confessions DVD. Good thing is that Akerlund did not edit and ruin this concert!The dancers...tour by tour Madonna dancers get uglier and scarier. I should really mention that few female dancers looked fantastic but boy, the guys were ugly! Remember her dancers during DWT and RIT - yeah, that was something...I don't know what she has in mind when she picks them up.Vocals...she did a good job singing most of the songs live this time as well, plus I do disagree with most of the reviewers saying that her voice was very much re-edited for the DVD.So what's the next...hopefully no more collaboration with Timbaland/Timberlake and Britney Spears look alikes, no haste tour productions and good quality music and performances - that's what Madonna has been doing for decades and I see no reason for quitting...
summary: Push the button...don't push the button...
